alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 08 at 8:20PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam affecting Juneau and Adams Counties. .Warm temperatures over the next several days will lead to melting of the existing snowpack upstream and result in an increase of river flows. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam. * WHEN...From late Sunday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 30,000.0 cfs, Localized flooding occurs near Highway Z and HH downstream of the dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:10 PM CDT Saturday the flow was 28,767.0 cfs. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Monday morning. - Flood flow is 30,000.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning.
